str2: According to the manner in which, in the degree that, just as, as. From kata and hos; just as, that.
Or Moses, or Mouses of Hebrew origin; Moseus, Moses, or Mouses, the Hebrew lawgiver.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (a) I raise on high, lift up, (b) I exalt, set on high. From hupsos; to elevate.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Probably from optanomai; a snake, figuratively, an artful malicious person, especially Satan.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Thus, so, in this manner. Or (referring to what precedes or follows).
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A son, descendent. Apparently a primary word; a 'son', used very widely of immediate, remote or figuratively, kinship.
A man, one of the human race. From aner and ops; man-faced, i.e. A human being.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Third person singular active present of deo; also deon deh-on'; neuter active participle of the same; both used impersonally; it is Necessary.
(a) I raise on high, lift up, (b) I exalt, set on high. From hupsos; to elevate.
